channel.title: Hardware Noob Looking For A Graphics Card (For WoW, mainly)
channel.description:
Here's my PC: http://h10010.www1.hp.com/wwpc/ca/en/ho/WF06b/12132708-12133156-12133158-12133158-12133158-80626463-81048011.html
The keyboard and such I can't really see mattering all too much, so the specs on the inside of the computer really shouldn't have changed since I purchased it; haven't opened it up for anything.
It's running Windows 7 Home Edition (upgraded from the given Vista), and runs World of Warcraft at an amazing speed of 10-20 FPS! (*sarcasm end*)
I had a graphics card in mind, before the upgrade to Windows 7, but it got lost in the transition. Would anybody care to suggest a graphics card that would work with my system? (between $80-$130 is what I'm looking at; I'm assuming something in that range could pull off ~60 FPS max settings in WoW according to another friend's card and PC)
I plan on also buying 2 GB worth of RAM to add on as well. If the sticks I buy for that matter, it'd be awesome if somebody could suggest some for that as well.
In case you can't tell, I'm completely clueless when it comes to hardware.

item.title: Hardware Noob Looking For A Graphics Card (For WoW, mainly)
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Ollie:

since when has gram size been the main factor of a graphics card? sure it can be the bottle neck but its by hell not as important as the ram speeds or ddr type

basically what ive been saying…

Read full topic

item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

cumescape:

Here you know what I take it back just get a EVGA 465GTX.

Wow I just noticed that the price on that isn’t really bad at all. To bad I want HDMI with audio out and that only has hdmi mini. Plus I need a ATI card to do express crossfire with the onboard graphics. So I guess I’m going to go with ATI for the first time ever.

yes but ddr2’s speed is going to be the bottleneck anyway

item.title: Hardware Noob Looking For A Graphics Card (For WoW, mainly)
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:16, topic:334647”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=431040.msg3164679#msg3164679 date=1269905190]

It depends which numbers you’re looking at. If you’re looking at the latency timings, higher numbers doesn’t mean it is faster
[/quote]Indeed. I’m not exactly cheering when I see the red computer symbol in-game, haha.

And lawl, wouldn’t I only be able to add RAM that the computer specs say the memory type is? I was under the assumption I would need a new motherboard or something. Or can the current accept DDR3 as well?

I’m not a big fan of asking to be spoon-fed, but I am literally absolutely clueless when it comes to any sort of hardware. Throw me a computer language, I can handle it. Put something metal in my palm… I’m gonna get nowhere.

Is there a certain brand of RAM I should look for? (I’ve been browsing NewEgg)

Hey said GDDR3 hes talking about video memory I assume, though im not sure. Also how many memory slots do you have it says 2GB X 1 which means you have 2, 1gb sticks and if you only have 2 slots you will have to scrap both to achieve 4gb. Futhermore I don’t see how many watts your PSU is so you may have to upgrade that.

EDIT: NVM I see it says 2DIMMS so you have 4 slots which means you can add 2 more 1gb sticks or 1 2gb stick

Heres ram: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820146526&cm_re=pc5300_2gb--20-146-526--Product

Research reveals that you have a 250Watt PSU good luck upgrading your video card with that your going to need something at least 500Watts.

As for those people that were suggesting 9800gtx you might as well go with the GTS250 I can vouch that this one kicks ass http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814133266&cm_re=GTS250--14-133-266--Product[/quote]
gddr3 is obviously graphics… hence the g

why get a gts250? thats way overkill

Read full topic
item.source: Hardware Noob Looking For A Graphics Card (For WoW, mainly)
